column4:
I fear Judge Barrett will cast the deciding vote to destroy the Affordable Care Act and strip health care from millions of people in Colorado and across the country for whom this is literally a matter of life and death.

This is #WhatsAtStake. https://t.co/wneFVe3R7C

#COVID19 has exposed the deeply unequal access to health care in this country. Katherine w/ @colorlatina explains how disparities have had a significantly negative effect on the Latinx community–particularly women. Equity in health care is #WhatsAtStake w/ this SCOTUS nomination. https://t.co/CRXm4rM6PE

Born with a preexisting condition, @BornToBeMighty – like many Americans – struggled to access health care prior to the ACA.
 
As Rae recovers from a bout with COVID, she knows that the coverage she and others fought so hard for is #WhatsAtStake with this SCOTUS nomination. https://t.co/IBlAfExodg

I’ve heard over and over from Coloradans about the toll this crisis has taken on their mental health. Our bipartisan bill will triple funding for the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline, ensuring those who are seeking help have an easier time finding it. https://t.co/9lXtg30CqL

My colleagues & I are asking @HHSgov & @USTreasury to analyze what the impact on health coverage would be if the ACA is overturned. Experts estimate over 20M Americans' health care is at risk––but that number could be even higher because of #COVID19. More: https://t.co/0Hs3X0YVxe

If the #ACA is overturned, @urbaninstitute estimates that CO will lose nearly $3B in federal investments in health care. We should be increasing funding for health care, not taking it away––especially during a global pandemic. 
 
This is #WhatsAtStake with this SCOTUS nomination. https://t.co/IHt8xRqnXu

A federal judge blocked a Trump Administration rule that would have taken #SNAP benefits away from nearly 700K Americans. Rather than taking food benefits away from food insecure families during a pandemic & economic crisis, we should increase SNAP benefits by 15%. #ProtectSNAP https://t.co/ogi01adv3y

It was incredibly moving to hear about @lpackard's journey as a cancer survivor. Laura knows firsthand #WhatsAtStake if McConnell succeeds in ramming through the president's Supreme Court nominee and millions of Americans lose their health care. Thank you for sharing your story. https://t.co/nqVrRMwrc5

Our PASTEUR Act is the strongest proposal to improve the appropriate use of antibiotics in our health care system. The funding model this bill creates would be subscription-based – not based on volume – so that manufacturers & providers can focus on what's best for patients. https://t.co/w0hy19kKEH

This pandemic has been a particularly hard time for the 1 in 5 individuals living in Colorado with a disability. I will continue to fight for their right to receive health care wherever they prefer, including their own home. 

We must swiftly pass the Disability Integration Act. https://t.co/JqXFm3OfVe

During the course of #COVID19, we've learned that we weren't prepared for a pandemic. 

With our bipartisan PASTEUR Act, we have the chance to not only learn from our mistakes but to invest in science & innovation to better prepare for the future. https://t.co/xaboW8XpnW

If McConnell succeeds in ramming through the president's Supreme Court nominee, the Affordable Care Act could be gutted.
 
If that happens, over 2 million Coloradans with preexisting conditions would lose protections.
 
Health care is #WhatsAtStake with this SCOTUS nomination. https://t.co/ovzpWW3WRf

New @JECDems report finds the #COVID19 pandemic & economic crisis have increased symptoms of anxiety and depression for nearly 38% of Coloradans. Instead of working to improve mental health care during this stressful time, Republicans are on a mission to repeal the #ACA. https://t.co/KxrUKwnJNP

Good morning from Fort Garland Museum in Costilla county! I heard from several county leaders & students from Sierra Grande schools about the challenges they're facing with #COVID19 & the drought. Our small but mighty communities need our support in the next COVID relief package. https://t.co/eRc2TK7eer

Coloradans are not asking us to get rid of the ACA. They want us to build on it so we can have a health care system that covers everyone in this country in an affordable way.
 
Instead, McConnell is jamming through a SCOTUS nominee & 600k Coloradans’ health care is #WhatsAtStake. https://t.co/HNk9IXCDGx

The current public health and economic crisis has precipitated an eviction crisis across the country. Today I had a chance to hear from the 12th Judicial District Access to Justice Committee about how communities can come together to fight evictions. https://t.co/PaF9qCso1C

Colorado is one of the fastest growing states in the country. An inaccurate count in the #2020Census could mean we lose out on our fair share of federal funding––further straining state and local resources as they work to recover after #COVID19. https://t.co/GRuUGgz67P

Instead of working to craft a bipartisan COVID relief package to support families in this crisis, @senatemajldr has made clear his top priority is ramming through Trump's SCOTUS nominee to dismantle the ACA. This is an abject failure of leadership when Americans need our support.

Grateful for the tour of @adamsstate w/ President Lovell. We discussed how the university is adapting to keep students, faculty & staff safe during the pandemic. We have to make sure schools have the resources to maintain a safe learning environment.

Photos: Adams State https://t.co/1S4fkIdGGd

#COVID19 has created unprecedented barriers for college students to register and vote. We should do everything we can to help. 

My op-ed with MSU President @janinedavidson ⬇️
https://t.co/b0U7ggRwjy

Had a great visit to @WolfCreekSki2 to hear suggestions for how the federal government can better support the ski industry.

My #RESTARTAct would help the hardest-hit small businesses and ski areas like Wolf Creek endure the economic challenges from the pandemic. https://t.co/1RSl12JJ6Q

Stopped by Pagosa Springs to visit a forest restoration site with the San Juan Headwaters Forest Partnership. 
 
We need a science-driven approach in collaboration with local communities to reduce the risk of catastrophic wildfires and improve the health of our forests. https://t.co/HObRpOqbfx

There is a growing mental health crisis in our country, with Coloradans 9 times more likely to report poor #mentalhealth during the pandemic. 
 
As Republicans continue attacking the Affordable Care Act–– this time through SCOTUS––access to mental health care is #WhatsAtStake. https://t.co/cei2CccZnF

President Trump & Leader McConnell have decided to walk away from the negotiating table so they can ram through a Supreme Court nominee. 

Coloradans are sick of the political games and need relief now.

I stand ready to negotiate in good faith with anyone willing to do the same.

The pandemic has dispersed college students across the country, upending where and how they will vote. That's why I introduced a bill in July to ask colleges nationwide to connect students with the resources they need to register and cast their ballots.

https://t.co/tjCNmWiq12

The admin's #COVID19 vaccination strategy barely acknowledges the disproportionate effect of COVID-19 on communities of color.
 
19 of my colleagues & I are demanding the admin address the alarming racial disparities. When a vaccine comes, we need an equitable distribution plan. https://t.co/BOEkumLySM

Reports of domestic violence have only increased during the pandemic, but the Senate has yet to pass the Violence Against Women Act to help protect survivors of domestic and sexual violence. The House reauthorized this critical bill LAST YEAR. It's time for the Senate to act. https://t.co/8huSbQKkIx

We all wish the President, the First Lady, and Hope Hicks a speedy and full recovery. 

As the coronavirus continues to spread, I urge everyone to social distance and wear a mask to keep themselves and others safe.

The US has underinvested in public health infrastructure for decades, leaving us ill-prepared to deal w/ #COVID19. @PattyMurray & I introduced the Public Health Infrastructure Saves Lives Act this week to provide states with the funding they need to strengthen our health systems.

Experts are sounding the alarm that drug-resistant bacteria will lead to another public health crisis. My new bill with @SenToddYoung would provide researchers with the resources to target the most threatening infections & improve the use of antibiotics. https://t.co/yKoYWFJdkE

The Senate just passed key reforms to Medicare's payments program to reduce interest rates & modify repayment obligations for health care providers facing immense financial strain due to #COVID19. Thrilled my proposal to provide critical relief is one step closer to becoming law.

Colorado is in the midst of one of our worst wildfire seasons in history. As the state balances responding to both #COVID19 and the fires, the federal government should mobilize its resources and expand support to reduce the burden on local governments. https://t.co/TNkHOFjff7

Prior to #COVID19, there were already concerns about conditions for immigrants in ICE custody–and transferring them from one ICE facility to another further threatens their health and risks spreading COVID-19. Our new bill would end unnecessary transfers.

https://t.co/pAV3IWFX4Q

Families should have every tool at their disposal when trying to find the right health care for their kids.
 
Our new bipartisan bill helps kids with complex medical conditions receive the treatment they need — no matter where they live. https://t.co/9dIcfKra7C

While our country grapples with the coronavirus, the addiction epidemic has continued to rage.
 
This week, @SenatorCollins and I introduced the MATE Act to equip our health providers to better identify, treat, and prevent addiction.
https://t.co/tQ4jdDWXJM

On the first day of fall, it's the perfect time to head outside and take in Colorado's beautiful scenery.

Grab a mask & enjoy!

📸: Jon Mullen https://t.co/Sg6QCtNcTL

Pandemic EBT provides families with funds to help buy food since schools were closed this spring.
 
If you have children who were eligible for free or reduced-priced meals, be sure to apply by tomorrow ⬇️ https://t.co/R7p8JJfFrA

It’s been SIX MONTHS since I led Senate Democrats in asking the White House for a national strategy on testing, PPE, and other supplies.
 
Nearly SEVEN MILLION #COVID cases later, and a @USGAO report shows they still have no plan. Unacceptable.

https://t.co/H1uhm7fVkz

I recently visited with behavioral health professionals and paramedics who respond to non-violent 911 calls instead of police as part of Denver's STAR Program. Great to learn more about how their efforts promote mental health and safety in Denver. https://t.co/HxRWCAB07o
Washington could learn from Colorado's example and finally develop a national strategy for testing and contact tracing.

Today I celebrated a new partnership in Denver between @ClaytonLearning and @garycommunity’s COVIDCheck Colorado program that will offer testing to Clayton’s teachers, staff, students and their households. https://t.co/jjPJxtyzFV

For months, we’ve called on the administration to end MFAR, a policy that would have led to across the board cuts to Medicaid and undermined vital care for kids and families during the pandemic.
 
I'm glad to see @SeemaCMS is heeding our call and withdrawing the policy. https://t.co/pDaxv9wdQV

The president ignored the science on climate change and #COVID19. Now all of us are paying the price.
 
Mr. President, America was able to harness electricity, invent the telephone, and put a man on the moon by embracing science, not denying it. https://t.co/pqrkSx5SQL

I’m grateful to announce @SenAngusKing has cosponsored the #BRIDGEAct—my bill to connect unserved neighborhoods, hospitals, schools & other areas to affordable, high-speed broadband.
 
We’re also seeing growing support from @CASBConnect, @ColoFarmBureau, @ruralhealth & more.

Congress should pass a relief package that extends the expanded unemployment benefit; provides funding for state & local governments; supports our hardest-hit small businesses with my #RESTARTAct; and invests in our public health infrastructure by establishing a #HealthForce.

It's been over 6 months since Colorado confirmed its first #COVID19 case. Since then, President Trump has failed to implement a national strategy to deal with the public health & economic crises—resulting in economic, health & food insecurity for millions of Americans.

ICYMI: @SenToddYoung & I wrote an op-ed about our bipartisan #RESTART Act & how it will help the hardest-hit small businesses stay afloat into 2021.

Read more to hear why we're calling on Congress to include RESTART in the next COVID relief package ⬇️ https://t.co/jzGpvVUmEp

I strongly support @GovofCo’s extension of the statewide mask order.

This is a moment for all of us to do our part and take personal responsibility by wearing a mask to protect our communities and reduce the spread of #COVID19.

Small businesses hit by #COVID19 are at the brink of failure.
 
@SenToddYoung & I have the solution. 
 
Let’s act urgently to pass the #RESTARTAct & help fuel the resurgence of the American economy—our small businesses don’t have any more time to waste.
 
https://t.co/EYSK9BK9Me

As I traveled across CO in August, I heard time & time again that expanding access to mental health care is critical for youth, veterans, seniors & many others. On #WorldSuicidePreventionDay & everyday, we must treat mental & behavioral health as an essential part of health care.

After I led my Colorado colleagues in urging @CDCgov to consider @CDPHE's application for Alzheimer’s and other dementia funding, I'm thrilled CDPHE will receive $200K. This funding will support critical work in CO to address this devastating disease. https://t.co/b4XsHkXeYp
Join us tomorrow to hear about the momentum building for the #RESTARTAct — the only bipartisan proposal of its kind to support small businesses hurt by the pandemic. https://t.co/oQhOU7AHO2

It is unacceptable that during this crisis, 1 in 3 CO families does not have enough to eat. @RepJoeNeguse & I have a common-sense proposal to increase SNAP benefits by 15% to feed families & keep our communities healthy as we battle #COVID19. Our op-ed ⬇️
https://t.co/qF7MmmSN4C

In the decade I've served in the Senate, I've seen a lot of wildfires across Colorado. This year we have #COVID on top of everything else.

The response from firefighters & local leaders is nothing short of inspirational.

Thank you. I'll keep fighting for the resources you need. https://t.co/txC8DpZBZm

County Commissioner @elisabethlaw spoke about the lack of guidance from Washington & how it's hurt their community.

We need a national strategy for testing & tracing. I’m fighting to establish a national #HealthForce to increase capacity & invest in public health infrastructure.

The pandemic has disproportionately affected Black & Brown communities. @SSDSupt_DrSmith put those students front & center of our discussion, speaking to the importance of dismantling inequitable policies in our education system. As a former superintendent, I couldn’t agree more.

Grateful to join @RepJoeNeguse, @emamula, @McCluskieforCO & other local leaders in Summit County to hear the ways #COVID19 has affected their economy, how they’re planning for ski season, and what the federal government can do to help them move forward. https://t.co/aLFUumbUA0

From Basalt to Aspen to Carbondale to Glenwood Springs to Breck to Granby—I had a great week meeting with Coloradans!

We heard about the challenges that #COVID19 & #wildfires have created for our mountain communities. I'll keep fighting for the guidance & resources you need. https://t.co/7G0oYtSZaN

Childcare & early childhood education systems were struggling even before #COVID19. As a local leader at this roundtable told me, now they are completely broken.

Working parents, childcare providers & kids ALL deserve better—including affordable childcare & universal preschool. https://t.co/Sl1KmNS2H0

Thanks to the parents, providers & leaders like @jhmceagle for the thoughtful discussion on childcare in Eagle County.

Olga, with Early Childhood Partners, described the enormous stress #COVID19 has placed on families who can’t afford childcare, rent & other basic needs. https://t.co/y8w1dWxxde

Inequities in access to higher education have worsened during the pandemic.

@ColoMtnCollege's Yesenia Arreola is working to expand access for first generation students & students of color, and started a fund to help Dreamers pay for college & realize their full potential. https://t.co/wP1tcMqnWp

DACA recipient Junior Ortega described the challenges he's faced with #COVID19. 

"I was an essential worker when lockdown happened, and I can't get a test."

We have to look out for Dreamers & #DACA families like Junior's now more than ever. https://t.co/YraAPr6lCP

Grateful to Voces Unidas de las Montañas & @alexfsanchez for organizing this meeting in Carbondale, where I had a chance to hear form local leaders on #DACA, #Census2020, and #COVID19. https://t.co/BVf4yTNUIN

Heard from health, business & education leaders, along with @MayorofGWS and other elected officials, in Garfield County today. @CMCPresident moderated an important discussion about the challenges they're facing due to #COVID19 and the need for more federal support. https://t.co/ToQbWjvayi

School without the internet is like school without textbooks. Especially in the face of #COVID19, ALL students must have broadband to learn & succeed. 

This @codepted commitment will help our state bridge the digital divide & support students & teachers. https://t.co/SUGs9NC9Jo

The iconic @RedRocksCO lit up red for #RedAlertRESTART this week! It's amazing to see so many Coloradans supporting my legislation to help small businesses hit hardest by the pandemic. Thank you for supporting #RESTARTAct to save live music venues. https://t.co/MCYK428JVW

This week, @DenversStation, @planetbluegrass, & Dillon Amphitheater lit up red to support my #RESTARTAct, legislation to help sustain the small businesses hit hardest by #COVID19. Grateful to have their support in Colorado. Let's get this done. #RedAlertRESTART https://t.co/Ex3w6lYQo9

Before I was a senator, I was Superintendent of Denver Public Schools.
 
So I’ve been in your shoes—ready to start the First Day of School, nervous about everything going smoothly & excited for the learning that awaits. 

But this year, we never could have anticipated #COVID19.

To students, teachers, school leaders & parents: 

As you head #BackToSchool amidst #COVID19—whether in person, online, or with a hybrid model—know that your entire community stands behind you.

Wear your mask. Keep your distance. And most important, never stop learning. https://t.co/XfArxSYd0E

We must do more to support local businesses, especially those hit hardest by the pandemic in the restaurant, service & hospitality industries. That’s why I’m fighting to pass the #RESTARTAct to provide relief into 2021. Thanks to @AspenInstitute for facilitating the discussion.

Small business leaders in the Roaring Fork Valley, like @MusicAtHeathers owners Rene & Heather Lujan and Sopris Liquor & Wine owner Kiko Peña, shared their greatest concerns in the face of #COVID19—especially as we approach the unpredictable winter months. https://t.co/hQlAgQAiE7

Like many communities, Pitkin County was hit hard by #COVID19. The local leaders I met today at @ACESaspen have responded in stride, working together to prepare for kids safely returning to classrooms, the winter outdoor recreation season, and ultimately a vaccine strategy. https://t.co/xc1xsckDfv

It's inspiring to see Coloradans step up in record numbers to help their communities conduct fair & safe elections. 

The public health crisis is creating unprecedented challenges—especially for traditionally older volunteers—& we must rise to the occasion to safeguard democracy. https://t.co/6KRw0DCvC1

Last night, over a thousand buildings lit up red in support of the #RESTARTAct, my bipartisan bill to support small businesses hurt by #COVID19. 

From the @space_needle to @TheGarden to @WNCathedral—support for RESTART is spreading across the country! #RedAlertRESTART https://t.co/9jywxFZEZP

This is great news for Coloradans. 

No one should have to choose between their health & their right to vote.

Colorado is setting the standard to hold a safe and fair election this November. Let's make sure all Americans across the country have this same opportunity. #VoteByMail https://t.co/MIQ6SJhJZJ

As wildfires threaten our communities, #COVID19 continues to undermine state & local budgets. In addition to funding, I‘ve encouraged @USDA to provide the flexibility local project sponsors need.
 
Read the letter @SenCoryGardner @RepJoeNeguse @RepTipton & I sent to @BillAtUSDA⬇️ https://t.co/uwgnfzOzQl

National Poll Worker Recruitment Day is a great opportunity to sign up to work the polls & #HelpAmericaVote. We're facing an unprecedented challenge this election with COVID—so if you're able, grab a friend, get involved & help strengthen our democracy! 

https://t.co/0dntMLsgRc https://t.co/QRaP7aVffP

Fourth, we should establish a national Health Force, my proposal w/@gillibrandny, to create jobs for people looking for work as contact tracers & case managers, so we can tackle the pandemic, create jobs & invest in public health infrastructure so this never happens again.

Today, the first of the month, families are trying to pay their bills, keep a roof over their head & put food on the table. Millions of people are out of work through no fault of their own, as we continue to face the damage of #COVID19. 
 
Here's what we should do about it ⬇️

Thanks to Scientific Director @emily_travanty & @CDPHE technicians for working 24/7 to strengthen our state’s #COVID19 response & keep Coloradans safe. I’ll continue to fight for funding to support our public health infrastructure, including our State Laboratory in Denver. https://t.co/uLamPVmbeb

From health leaders to farmers to business leaders, I was inspired by the impressive, collaborative work being done in communities across the Eastern Plains. Some highlights ⬇️ https://t.co/vOxgY2EGZ9

Today, I visited Nate McCaffrey's farm in Vona where the current drought and low commodity prices have forced Nate to make the tough decision to suspend his no-till operations that focused on soil health and return to more conventional practices. https://t.co/1iWXOzAj7V

As I’ve traveled across CO this month, I’ve seen farmers continue to find new ways to improve soil health and conserve water––two key ingredients for a sustainable farm. It’s critical that the Farm Bill and other federal programs continue to support innovative farming practices.

Thank you you to every Coloradan who invited me into their community and shared their story. Even in these dark times, with a global pandemic and economic turmoil, you give me hope that we will build back stronger, safe, and more resilient than ever before.

In Monte Vista, I visited Mitchell Farms—where local farmers are choosing practices that maximize water conservation, soil health & carbon sequestration to fight changing weather.

They are part of a broad coalition we must build to create durable #climatechange solutions. https://t.co/WIGQEDTiv1

In Center, I heard from the “promotoras” — a network of regular folks turned community health advocates who came together to navigate a coronavirus outbreak in their town, overcoming language and literacy barriers to bring critical information to families. https://t.co/SEu7FgKmTW
The president’s dangerous and unhinged conspiracy theories continue to undermine our doctors and scientists and make it more difficult to respond to the pandemic. https://t.co/zdaLrKCu0X

Learned about the sustainability measures Mike Litzenberger Farms in Longmont is working on with Colorado sugar beet farmers to reduce input costs, increase yields, improve soil health, and sequester carbon – making farming more sustainable and more profitable. https://t.co/dPiNXLQhyW

Mitchell Farms is a great example of how local farmers are choosing farming practices that maximize their water conservation, soil health, and carbon sequestration. These practices will help fight climate change. https://t.co/OMqF0P8ydG
Purell. Masks. Ready for our next socially-distanced meeting. #WearAMask https://t.co/8cwtwDrhYO

We can learn a lot from Center and their community-driven effort to successfully manage the virus. We need community health efforts like this across Colorado and the country. That's why I've proposed a national Health Force to expand our public health workforce.

The pandemic magnified language and literacy barriers within the community, so a trusted network of promotoras provided accurate, consistent information about #COVID19 to families who had previously received very little outreach or information about the virus.

Today, I heard the incredible story of a network of community health educators – or promotoras – in Center who came together to navigate a #COVID19 outbreak in their community. https://t.co/7tZeH49G86

What a powerful tribute that began in Colorado honoring women health care workers of color who are fighting #COVID19 on the front lines. 
Thank you for all that you do to care for our communities during this crisis.
 
https://t.co/V0z81dZc5j
It should concern everyone that the Trump Administration is actively undermining @USPS in the middle of a pandemic and right before the November election. https://t.co/X24ZXJhRwh

Again and again, the president has tried to sabotage the census. Now he's cutting it short by a month in the middle of a pandemic.

We must ensure enough time for an accurate count. https://t.co/COJINbAn9j

Since day one, the administration has played politics with the census. Now it's trying to cut it short by a month in the middle of a pandemic. We can't allow this to stand.

Congress must ensure the census has enough time to conduct an accurate count in CO and across the country. https://t.co/hhjsUN4PbI

The National Guard has been critical to #COVID19 response efforts in Colorado and across the country.
 
It is not the time to be cutting its funding. https://t.co/QPdlEd2C43

The high incidence of #COVID19 outbreaks at meat processing plants early in the pandemic hurt CO workers & our communities. The govt’s response raises a lot of questions. 
I'm calling for an investigation into the federal govt's role in the spread of COVID-19 at these facilities. https://t.co/5PLzFEmx5R

With each rollback, President Trump betrays the hard work of local leaders in Colorado and across the country, drags us further behind in the urgent fight against climate change, and threatens our children's health and future.

The Trump Administration is reportedly poised to roll back EPA’s protections against methane pollution, continuing its ideological assault on our health, environment, and economy. 
 
https://t.co/CD66YwkGYr

As Claire Qureshi & @rajpanjabi say, the foundation of a strong response to #COVID19 is community health workers. We must include my Health Force with @gillibrandny in the next package to create these jobs while fulfilling our nation's public health needs.
https://t.co/VQ7J6d7uQA

This is exactly why I proposed the Force to Fight COVID-19 earlier this week. It’s a comprehensive plan I wrote with several colleagues to dramatically scale up our health and social services workforce to support front line workers and meet this challenge.https://t.co/SLaStqLUnG

According to @hungerfreeco, 1 in 3 Coloradans report being food insecure since the beginning of the pandemic. Nearly 1 in 4 parents report cutting back on food.
 
This is unacceptable. We must increase SNAP benefits so families can get the food they need. https://t.co/Dm1MhM54ft

A mask challenge is one I'm more than happy to take, @DrJudyMonroe. Since March, @SenToomey & I have pushed Americans to wear masks as an easy & inexpensive way to protect our communities. I'm challenging @RepJoeNeguse to #WearAMask & join us in stopping the spread of #COVID19. https://t.co/JHa8qxV1uL https://t.co/3Tn6227qN7

30-40 million Americans, including as many as 596,000 Coloradans, are at risk of eviction in 2020. 

We cannot allow a public health crisis to turn into an eviction crisis. It’s time for Republicans to negotiate in good faith so we can pass a relief bill. https://t.co/cCKXlIJfjT

The president's incompetence will force states to hold the 2020 election during a pandemic that has continued to spread.

The least Congress can do is provide real funding to our election officials and @USPS to ensure that every American can vote safely this November.
Since the beginning of this pandemic, I've demanded we respond to this crisis with a plan that matches its magnitude. This proposal does just that, and we must include it in the next relief package.

My colleagues and I put forward a joint proposal that combines seven health and social service workforce bills—including my #HealthForce with @gillibrandny—into a dynamic package. https://t.co/cU2AWg1sSP

The @USPS is vital to our country, but #COVID19 is threatening its operations – endangering mail-in voting & our election.
 
I'm urging Senate leadership to include emergency funding for the USPS and hazard pay for its employees in the next relief package.
https://t.co/EChdmj0LVc

From running testing sites to restocking food banks, the National Guard has been critical to the #COVID19 response. Extending federal deployment is the right move, but cutting funding for this effort by 25% is not. 
 
https://t.co/hUjwsCqlfU

Last week, my colleagues and I called on the administration to extend full federal funding for the Colorado National Guard deployment to help fight this pandemic.
 
https://t.co/DgvgkpFgwQ
Thanks for your leadership in the push for #Masks4All across the world, @jeremyphoward. https://t.co/wike8WIhr3

Talked about working together for Coloradans over lunch with State Senate President Leroy Garcia & State Representatives Bri Buentello and Donald Valdez, and met with @PuebloHealth alongside the region’s main health care providers who are combatting the pandemic collaboratively. https://t.co/LnlGas1n7q

We must address the dramatic effect #COVID19 has had on Americans' mental health—particularly for minority communities. I'm cosponsoring the Mental Health Equity Act to improve mental health for communities of color at a time when accessing resources is more difficult than ever. https://t.co/vEF9VEJVdw

.@usedgov's attempt to exclude DACA recipients from emergency financial aid cuts them off from vital assistance & jeopardizes their wellbeing during a pandemic. We've repeatedly pushed DeVos to ensure these students have access to relief. Our letter➡️https://t.co/aDHZ285g2o https://t.co/bHtgfYPTKx

The expanded unemployment benefits have been a lifeline to families during the worst downturn since the Great Depression.
 
We cannot let them expire, which is why I have a commonsense proposal to tie these benefits to the health of our economy. https://t.co/6oOiFuQYpK

.@USPS is facing increased and unprecedented challenges due to COVID-19. The Postal Service has always delivered for us – now it's time for us to deliver for them. The Postal Service and its employees need relief in the next #COVID19 package.

It should not take a pandemic to make us focus on the profound racial disparities that have plagued our health care system for decades. We should listen to leaders like @bfrist and @DrMedows and confront these inequities at every level.
 
https://t.co/HilZC5BdaP

Months ago, I introduced a proposal with @SenJackReed to continue expanded unemployment benefits but tie them to the health of our economy. They'd stay in place until the economy heals, but not beyond that.

It's common sense, and we should take it up as soon as Congress returns.

Because of #COVID19, millions of college students abruptly left campus and still don’t know if they’ll be returning this fall. 

Our bill calls on America’s universities to fulfill their civic responsibility to help students exercise their right to vote. https://t.co/a953Jvaucm
RT @YoungInvincible: Well before #COVID19, college students faced unique barriers in registering to vote & voting. The National Emergency S…

Unidentified federal agents should not be terrorizing protesters exercising their First Amendment rights in a healthy democracy.

This week, my colleagues and I introduced a bill that aims to prevent the federal government from using these tactics.
 
https://t.co/aKeNLrtBVv

All personally identifiable information collected to fight COVID-19 must be deleted or de-identified upon termination of the disease cycle, as determined by public health experts.

At the federal level, the CDC must remain the sole entity responsible for managing COVID data. No private third party, state government, or other federal department, including law enforcement or national security agencies, should have access to such data.

Americans must be given the choice to opt-in to any data collection related to COVID-19 and have a clear right to refuse.

Individuals must also have the right to remove their data if they choose.

As the world races to apply digital tools to fight the pandemic, the U.S. should set an example for how to balance their potential value with their limitations and risks.
